intro: Dalechampia scandens var. brasiliensis, commonly known as the Brazilian roughleaf hemp, is a climbing shrub native to South America. It belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family and is characterized by its rough, hairy stems and large, heart-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, inconspicuous flowers followed by distinctive, spiny, greenish capsules. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, often found in moist, shaded environments. Due to its ornamental value and potential medicinal properties, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens.
